ai-tika-vin05t23:37_7: If he hears about the teaching in an inhabited area or at the dwelling, he thinks, “This is your preceptor or teacher’s teaching me about it. If he hears or gets rid of it, hencets it when the preceptor goes on hearing, or he dies,”
ai-tika-vin05t23:38_1: “An arrival should live with formal support for five years: but one who is incompetent should live with such support for life.”
ai-tika-vin05t23:38_2: If he doesn’t get the full ordination, he shouldn’t do the same, or he should put his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and make an effort to get him squat on his heels.
ai-tika-vin05t23:38_3: When asked whether he is the village, he should put his sarong in a village, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say, “An teacher. Please do the duties.”
ai-tika-vin05t23:38_4: and unshakable things should be cut off all attachments:
ai-tika-vin05t23:39_0: But who is competent and capable of doing the full ordination with that person is allowed to live without formal support.
ai-tika-vin05t23:39_1: So he should remove all four, that is to say, the group of five hundred, that is to say, the recommendation for the purpose of showing the surface of the Faith, two endless virtues, namely, the Mahāpajāpatī Gotamī, together with the Vibhaṅga thus: “Suching the Faith, the Protector of the World, the World, the World, the Great Seer of the World, the World, the Faith, of the World, of the Truth, the Pacceka, and the Three Jambudīpa Jambudīpa Ārāma, Tambapaṇṇi. Arahanthantship, Twelded by the Faitnesses in the ninery matters, the deeds, and the nineteended by the Dhamma, and the Vihāra Vihāra, and the Nuncies in order to say
ai-tika-vin05t23:39_2: This is how learned, a learned one, wherever he can find his own master,
ai-tika-vin05t23:40_0: “Mendicants, a monk who has five qualities shouldn’t live without formal support.
ai-tika-vin05t23:40_1: He doesn’t have the virtue, stillness,
ai-tika-vin05t23:40_2: the wisdom there is from the entire spectrum of wisdom,
ai-tika-vin05t23:40_3: or the entire spectrum of an adept’s ethics,
ai-tika-vin05t23:40_4: or knowledge and vision of freedom of one fully trained,
ai-tika-vin05t23:40_5: A monk who has these five qualities shouldn’t live without formal support.
ai-tika-vin05t23:41_0: “Mendicants, a monk who has five qualities shouldn’t live without formal support.
ai-tika-vin05t23:41_1: He has no faith, conscience, or moral prudence, is lazy and absentminded.
ai-tika-vin05t23:41_2: A monk who has these five qualities shouldn’t live without formal support.
ai-tika-vin05t23:42_0: “Mendicants, a monk who has five qualities shouldn’t live without formal support.
ai-tika-vin05t23:42_1: He has failed in the higher morality; he has failed in conduct; he has failed in view; he’s ignorant; he’s foolish.
ai-tika-vin05t23:42_2: A monk who has these five qualities shouldn’t live without formal support.
ai-tika-vin05t23:43_0: “Mendicants, a monk who has five qualities shouldn’t live without formal support.
ai-tika-vin05t23:43_1: He doesn’t know the offenses; he doesn’t know the non-offenses; he doesn’t know which offenses are light; he doesn’t know which offenses are heavy; neither Monastic Code has been properly learned by him in detail, and he has not well analyzed them, thoroughly mastered them, or well investigated them, either in terms of the rules or their detailed exposition.
ai-tika-vin05t23:43_2: A monk who has these five qualities shouldn’t live without formal support.
ai-tika-vin05t23:44_0: “Mendicants, a monk who has five qualities shouldn’t live without formal support.
ai-tika-vin05t23:44_1: He doesn’t know the offenses; he doesn’t know the non-offenses; he doesn’t know which offenses are light; he doesn’t know which offenses are heavy;
ai-tika-vin05t23:44_2: A monk who has these five qualities shouldn’t live without formal support.”
ai-tika-vin05t23:44_3: And it should be given in the first phrase ascribing the conclusion, and he should then be seen in the way already described.
ai-tika-vin05t23:45_0: but an ignorant and incompetent teachers should not be given permission.
ai-tika-vin05t23:45_1: If the teacher gives, the pupils to those who understand,
ai-tika-vin05t23:45_2: If they have not been given, but they go to the gathering,
ai-tika-vin05t23:46_0: “When a number of monks are ignorant and incompetent, their teachers ask:
ai-tika-vin05t23:46_1: Those teachers and preceptors should go with them.
ai-tika-vin05t23:46_2: If they’re going with others who are foolish and incompetent,
ai-tika-vin05t23:46_3: If the teachers and preceptors should not allow them to give their permission, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-tika-vin05t23:46_4: If they’re going with others who are ignorant and incompetent, the teacher commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-tika-vin05t23:47_0: Thus there is the exposition of the teaching on the Monastic Law, in the preceding the Monastic Law
